Key Match Events: The Tigers' win streak ended with a 3-0 loss to the Angels.
Rookie right-hander Jack Kochanowicz pitched six shutout innings for the Angels.
Zach Neto hit his 20th homer of the season, a 400-footer to left-center.
Ben Joyce struck out Spencer Torkelson with a 95-mph sinker to end a bases-loaded threat in the eighth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The Tigers were on a six-game win streak and were 4½ games back of the final wild card spot before the game.
Post-Match Reflections: AJ Hinch emphasized the importance of focusing on the present and not looking ahead.
Zach McKinstry noted the team's struggle to get the big hit despite getting runners on base.
Tarik Skubal highlighted the importance of winning each game rather than focusing on standings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Angels snapped a seven-game losing streak with the win.
Tigers rookie right-hander Keider Montero struggled with command, walking three and throwing 89 pitches in five innings.
Joey Wentz was hit by two comebackers, one on his left hand and another on his right knee, and had to leave the game.
